content.description:
The Waugh Crack is located on the north face of the Lechlinski Cracks formation and is identified by a thin finger crack.  Crank through the thin finger crack with poor feet (crux) right off the deck and continue up to easier ground.  Bring a couple of hand size pieces for anchor.

Descend by scrambling off climber's left.
content.protection: Light rack up to a #1 size (red) Camalot, plus a couple of hand size pieces to build an anchor.

content.description: Follow the left slanting crack to a vertical crack.
content.location: A left slanting crack in the recess to the left of the S-crack.

content.description: Not a classic, but worth doing.  It's a ways left of the Lechlinski crack, a right curving thin crack you can see from the road.
This is a short, well-protected thin crack.
content.location: As you walk left from Waugh Crack and Black Nipple Fetish, go past a recess and get to another wall.  Go just around the corner to the left and it's the lefthand thin crack.

content.description:
Scramble up boulders to base of route.  The route is identified by twin "cracks", although the left crack is more of a flake.  The crux is low off the ground.  Great jamming above.

Descend via rapping off flake slung with webbing and one quicklink.  Webbing needs replacement as of 10/1/02.

climbs.name: Keith's Ripped Back
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Marco and friend, Keith, Kate Duke, Cyndie Bransford

content.description: To the right of The Lechlinski Cracks is a small slab; This is Keith's Crag. There are two short climbs on Keith's Crag;  this is the right of the two.
content.protection: 1 FP, 3 bolts to a bolted anchor.  Walk off.
content.location: On the small slab just right of the Lechlinski Cracks.

climbs.name: Keith's 10,000 Girlfriends
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Keith, Susan Reid, Kate Duke, Cyndie Bransford, Marco and friends

content.description: To the right of the Lechlinski Cracks is a small slab;  This is Keith's Crag.  There are two short routes on it. Keiths' 10,000 Girlfriends is the left of the two routes.
content.protection: Three bolts to a bolted anchor.  Walk off.
content.location: On the small slab to the right of the Lechlinski Cracks.

climbs.name: Crazy Xenoliths
climbs.fa: teun von dijks, Lila Queiroz, Jan-thijs Menger, Elliot Balsley, Todd Gordon

content.description: Climb the face/arete right of Lechlinski Cracks.

Start 20' left and around the corner from the

Waugh Crack

. The epitome of thin face climbing. The first bolt can be clipped from the ground, with the crux encountered shortly thereafter. Descend by scrambling off climber's left.
content.protection: Pro: 5 bolts, plus a couple of hand size pieces for anchor.
